document.masterDocTitle: Agrotis Ochsenheimer (Lepidoptera, Noctuidae): a systematic analysis of South American species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Agrotis Ochsenheimer (Lepidoptera, Noctuidae): a systematic analysis of South American species

bibRefCitation.author: Butler
bibRefCitation.refString: Butler, A. G. (1882) Heterocerous Lepidoptera collected in Chili by Thomas Edmonds. Part II, Noctuites. Transactions of the Royal Entomological Society of London, 30 (2), 113 - 139. http: // dx. doi. org / 10.1111 / j. 1365 - 2311.1882. tb 01573. x

(redescription). Lectotype : ♂ Chile [Valdivia February according to original publication] (Edmonds) ( BMNH ). Present designation. Image examined. Paralectotype : ♀ Chile [Valdivia February according to original publication] (Edmonds) ( BMNH ). Not examined. Present designation.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. In
Köhler ( 1967 )
figures 31 and 33 of
Scotia edmondsi
(=
Agrotis edmondsi
) are correct, but figures 30 and 32 of
Scotia araucaria
(=
Agrotis araucaria
) correspond to light specimens of
Agrotis edmondsi
.

Material examined. (
141 ♂
, 105 ♀).
